enWisdom: Covetousness is a besieging (or and evident) indigence
The most indigent of people is the coveter
The most harmful thing is covetousness

Wisdom: أَكْثَرُ مَصَارِعِ الْعُقُولِ تَحْتَ بُرُوقِ الْمَطَامِعِ
enWisdom: The places where intellects become most deficient are under the flashes of greed
The fruit of covetousness is wretchedness
The cause of corruption of certitude is covetousness
One whose covetousness increases, his downfall becomes greater

Wisdom: مَنْ طَلَبَ الزِّيَادَةَ وَقَعَ فِي النُّقْصَانِ
enWisdom: One who seeks more [than what has been apportioned for him], falls into loss

Wisdom: لَا تَطْمَعْ فِي كُلِّ مَا تَسْمَعُ فَكَفَى بِذَلِكَ غِرَّةً
enWisdom: Do not desire for everything that you hear, for this suffices as gullibility (or foolishness)

Wisdom: لَا تُطْمِعَنَّ نَفْسَكَ فِيمَا فَوْقَ الْكَفَافِ فَيَغْلِبَكَ بِالزِّيَادَةِ
enWisdom: Never let yourself covet that which is above your needs thereby letting it overcome you with the desire for more

Wisdom: لَا تَطْمَعْ فِي كُلِّ مَا تَسْمَعُ فَكَفَى بِذَلِكَ‏ حُمْقاً
enWisdom: Do not relate to the people all that you hear, for this suffices as silliness (or foolishness)
A little covetousness corrupts a lot of piety
Religion does not remain safe with avarice
The corruption of religion is [caused by] covetousness
How bad a companion of religion covetousness is!
